intro: Corydalis begljanovae, commonly known as the Begljanov's corydalis, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Corydalis begljanovae is a herbaceous perennial, and it thrives in cool, moist environments with partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
